Job Description: Secureworks (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a global cybersecurity leader that secures human progress with Secureworks® Taegis™, a SaaS-based, open XDR platform built on 20+ years of real-world threat intelligence and research, improving customers’ ability to detect advanced threats, streamline and collaborate on investigations, and automate the right actions. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team. Role Overview This role is core to our Partner First success working with our partner community to generate and develop new sales opportunities through a variety of means. You’ll initiate prospect relationships to enable value driven conversations, driving prospect interest throughout the early stages of the sales cycle and partnering with our partners and field sales teams on appropriate sales activities to achieve revenue quota objectives. You’ll be passionate about what we can do in partnership to protect our customers.  You will be provided training in sales and cyber security principles and solutions. Role Responsibilities Initiate, master and maintain on-going relationships with partners and prospects, via the phone, email and web, scoping on LinkedIn, attending industry events. Understand partner and prospect business and information security environments Position and match Secureworks capability to each partner and prospect business driver and challenge  Communicate effectively and establish win/win partnership with partner and regional sales representatives. Serve as the initial point of contact with targeted companies and partner sales teams Work with our channel partners to build account plans and contact strategies Essential Requirements Ideally a minimum of 2 years of experience of cybersecurity software and or SaaS Solutions within an Inside Sales / Lead Generation role. Strong ability and awareness to grasp complex, sophisticated solution service sales processes and position effectively to prospects Ability, passion and desire to prioritise prospects and generate new opportunities through research, prospecting phone calls and networking Team oriented with ability to thrive and add to a competitive, energy filled environment Persistence and willingness to learn and adapt on a daily basis Self-starter who is motivated and able to work with minimal supervision Must be fluent in English to a professional level both written and spoken; French may be beneficial Secureworks is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Secureworks are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Secureworks will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Technical Support Engineer At Dell Technologies, world-class service doesn’t end when a customer purchases our innovative products. Our Managed As A Service Technical Support team is there for them whenever they need help – by phone, email and chat. No matter how complex the challenge, we rise to it. If there’s an issue with a customer’s product, we’ll analyze it, identify the cause, recommend a solution and document the problem. Job Title: NextGen Presales Academy - Associate Solutions Architect
Job Description: NextGen Presales Academy - Associate Solutions Architect  Stockholm, Sweden At Dell Technologies, we are committed to creating innovative technologies that drive human progress. Our goal is to help our customers thrive in this constantly evolving digital world by delivering essential technology solutions to help move them forward. Powered by a workforce that values and celebrates different backgrounds, we create solutions that harness and amplify technology in the most meaningful ways. From hybrid cloud and high-performance computing to ambitious social impact and sustainability initiatives, what we do impacts everyone, everywhere. Join us as an  Associate Solution Architect  in our  Pre-Sales team in  London  to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. What you’ll achieve: The Dell Technologies  NextGen Presales Academy  is a 15 – 30-month experiential training program designed to develop early-in-career & recent university graduates into skilled  Presales Solutions Architects . The role of a  Presales Solutions Architect  blends the art of sales with the science of technology. We strive to act as trusted advisors to our customers to help recommend and design technology-based products and solutions. Following the program, participants will progress into a role as part of an industry leading presales organization where they will work with sales teams to help customers accomplish their IT initiatives and solve business challenges.   You Will: Develop your knowledge of Dell Technologies’ data center solutions   Develop professional consultative skills used to gather customer requirements and IT environment specifics.   Work with diverse teams and individuals to collaboratively architect unique solutions that drive customer innovation using cutting-edge technologies.   Learn, practice & deliver presentations & demos to customers, highlighting product features, benefits & business value.   Study the latest trends such as Cloud Computing, DevOps, Data Security and Artificial Intelligence which are changing how customers deploy and operate IT infrastructure & applications.   Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements  Fluency in Swedish and English Proven technology skills, outstanding interpersonal abilities, strong written and verbal communication skills.   Attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.   Being an innovative thinker and a self-starter with a desire-to-win type mindset.   Undergraduate Degree in a technical or business-related field.   Desirable Requirements  Internship or work experience in technology-related field or a technology company.   Who we are We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. Working at the cutting edge, we design and develop software for platforms, peripherals, applications and diagnostics — all with the most advanced technologies, tools, software engineering methodologies and the collaboration of internal and external partners. Job Description: Pasante de Aprendizaje y Desarrollo – Operaciones de Ventas Únete a nuestro equipo para realizar el mejor trabajo de tu carrera y lograr un profundo impacto social como  Pasante de Aprendizaje y Desarrollo – Operaciones de Ventas  en nuestro equipo  Operaciones de Ventas  en  Panama. ¿Qué hay para ti?  • Desarrolla aún más tu fluidez en inglés.  • Aprenda a ampliar su red de contactos dentro de un entorno corporativo.  • Adquirir experiencia en el intercambio de comunicaciones regionales e internacionales.  • Aprenda a utilizar y gestionar los datos para el desarrollo de formaciones en ventas.  • Ejercita tu creatividad para encontrar formas nuevas y funcionales de transformar positivamente el negocio.  • Aprenda de un equipo diverso y talentoso de profesionales que lo ayudarán a desarrollar sus habilidades.   • Exposición a cómo funciona una empresa de interfuncionamiento - 500.  Qué harás en colaboración con el equipo: • Realizar actividades operativas que ayudarán a impulsar la eficiencia del equipo • Proporcionar soporte operativo y de capacitación para los equipos de ventas y preventa. • Investigar los problemas de las partes interesadas y ofrecer soluciones creativas • Apoyar los esfuerzos de comunicación y intercambio de información con nuestra fuerza de ventas y organizaciones multifuncionales. Principal Cloud Native Architect When our customers are looking for IT consulting expertise, where else would they turn but to the company driving human progress through technology? Our Solutions Architecture team within Professional Services are experts in package customization and integration as well as total, end-to-end solutions in targeted industry segments. After thorough consultation with our customers and careful analysis, we develop new IT systems or replace existing systems that support customers’ strategic, operational and financial goals. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a  Principal Cloud Native Architect  on our  Cloud Native Center of Excellence  in  Singapore . What you’ll achieve An opportunity to work for a company whose software is utilized by every Fortune 500 company and significantly impacts every industry. You will be a part of a collaborative environment whose teams care about the product they are creating, how they create it, and the impact it has on customers’ business objectives. More importantly, you drive the opportunity to collaborate and work interactively with our clients to ensure their successful deployment of the Kubernetes platform on-premise or cloud IaaS. Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing? Provide technical direction for the development, and design of Cloud Native architectures, standards, and implementation approaches and systems integration for client engagement and product/ solution development from the definition phase through implementation. As a member of the Cloud Native Architecture group, you will be expected to work with and contribute to its Kubernetes-based microservices architecture, and all your deliverables must align with the group’s development and deployment standards. Demonstrate leadership in IT management by producing strategic and innovative concept proposals, and papers, and speaking at conferences. What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis? Recognize system deficiencies and implement effective solutions. Communicate and enforce best practices for building and running applications on Kubernetes Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships. Manages client interactions and expectations regarding architectures. Organizing tech talks and participating in meetups/events. Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Experienced Software Enterprise Architect with demonstrated skills in designing PaaS solutions, enterprise middleware, and Java Spring­ microservices based mission-critical applications. Understands complex enterprise, cloud-based concepts and effectively employs different design techniques; A clear understanding of cloud service and deployment models. Experience with more than one relational database management systems;  Understands the benefits and ideal uses of various programming languages. Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage with Senior level leaders. Ability to travel and work on-site with customers  and partners. Sustainability and Enviornmental, Social & Governance (ESG) Regional Lead  Dell Technologies has a huge amount to say – on technology, on innovation, on business, on human progress and our Corporate Communications team makes sure those messages are heard. They are responsible for developing and driving global and regional communication strategies and delivering marketing services. Their expertise shapes the way Dell Technologies is seen – enhancing our reputation, brand and valuation on the global stage. Crucially, they enable us to build productive, positive and transformative relationships with colleagues, customers and the media. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a  Sustainability and Enviornmental, Social & Governance (ESG) Regional Lead  on our Sustainability  and ESG Customer and Regional  Team in  Hong Kong. What you’ll achieve The APJ/China Sustainability and ESG Lead role will be responsible for overseeing Dell’s Sustainability and ESG strategy for APJ/China, in partnership with Dell’s regional teams, including but not limited to Sales, regional product teams, Corporate Accounting and Statutory, Government Affairs, Corporate Affairs, Marketing and Communications. The position involves representing our global Sustainability & ESG strategy and priorities within the region; collaborating to establish and execute a region-specific Sustainability & ESG strategy and plan, working closely with internal business leaders as an extension of our global ESG operations and governance, which is a hub and spoke model; managing associated ESG regulatory requirements; and engaging with external stakeholders including customers, partners, and non-governmental organizations. You will: Establish and lead coordination, execution and accountability of region-specific Sustainability & ESG strategy, plan and priorities, in direct alignment with global strategy and plan Support and lead proactive management of customer and partner engagements, inquiries, and collaborations on Sustainability & ESG topics and priorities Oversee regional and country specific ESG reporting with an emphasis on understanding and aligning to regulatory requirements Identify and communicate regional and global ESG issues and the implications for Dell’s businesses and reputation to senior management Research and analyze regional and country specific ESG issues, and identify areas of potential reputational or business risk as well as opportunities Work within the CS & ESG team and our hub and spoke operating model to bring regional and country-level representation into the design and implementation of regional ESG initiatives that benefit Dell’s ESG goals, leadership positioning and impact Participate in external meetings with customers and other stakeholders to represent Dell’s Sustainability & ESG strategy, approach, and to share best practices Support Sales leaders in their efforts to build and maintain external relationships within a country by providing ESG-related strategic advice, talking points and background information, leveraging work done globally Be a value-added resource to senior management and business leaders to provide insight and guidance on ESG risks in the region and how to manage those risks Participate as an active member of the CS & ESG team to maintain close coordination and alignment on global ESG issues and priorities Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Minimum 10+ years of experience in ESG (sustainability, corporate social responsibility) Strong understanding of ESG issues as they impact business and the technology sector Strong knowledge of technology products, services, and terminology Highly developed emotional intelligence and ability to influence others, including experience engaging senior business leaders Collaborative mindset, and ability to work with a wide range of internal partners Exceptional work ethic, with the ability to multi-task and work in a high-performance professional environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills Desirable Requirements: Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree preferred Who we are: We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. Job Title: Graduate Software Engineer - Data Analytics Specialist
Job Description: When creating technology that drives human progress, everything needs to be spot on. Our Supplier Process Engineering team works with our suppliers to enable them to produce materials and components of the highest quality. Working closely with our product developers, we select and monitor vendors and suppliers who can meet our high engineering and quality standards. In addition, we perform regular auditing and undertake design and development engineering assignments to develop new products or update existing products. We’re also experts in establishing systems and procedures to enhance overall quality. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a   Software Engineer  on our Supplier Process Engineering Team in Singapore. We assess and qualify suppliers who can meet our engineering and quality standards. In addition, we’re also experts in establishing systems and procedures to enhance overall quality. We manage product and process quality and keep driving continuous quality improvements. We will provide comprehensive training and coach you during your internship, such as general quality, manufacturing techniques, supplier management, and data analysis. etc. You will: You will be responsible for supplier-quality data collection and analysis.  You will work with the commodity SQE team and platform SQE team to drive quality improvements based on your data analysis report.  Your contribution will help the team to identify improvement opportunities.  Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Secureworks (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a global cybersecurity leader that secures human progress with Secureworks® Taegis™, a SaaS-based, open XDR platform built on 20+ years of real-world threat intelligence and research, improving customers’ ability to detect advanced threats, streamline and collaborate on investigations, and automate the right actions. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team. Role Responsibilities This critical role will be responsible for serving as a key business partner and performing audit assignments covering the Secureworks audit universe. Teammates are expected to have a minimum general level of information technology audit experience, general business audit insights, and proficiency in performing audits conforming to professional standards. Work assigned is expected to be carried out with limited supervision. The complexity and size of audit assignments will vary depending on the engagement. Decisions regarding the scope of work performed, nature of test procedures, and the reporting of results may be delegated to this position with guidance from the Internal Audit leadership team. Develops and fosters positive relationships between the audit function and the business units. Partners and collaborates with co-source provider on various audit engagements. Conducts technology and business process audits to cover the audit universe while supporting business partners. Leverages tools and technology to enable efficiency and effectiveness in the audit process (i.e. AI, analytics, automation). Properly evaluates audit evidence (e.g., weighing the relevancy, accuracy, and completeness) leading to efficient and effective audit conclusions. Develops and enhances audit programs. Creates high quality audit workpapers and other deliverables. Develops visualization and reports to communicate audit results to leadership.  Provides strategic insights and added-value observations to leadership and auditees. Performs audit finding remediation testing. Partners with key 2nd line of defense functions (e.g., Compliance, Risk Management, CSO) to reduce audit fatigue. Coordinates with external auditors to maximize Internal Audit SOX testing reliance. Performs ad hoc analysis, projects and special investigations as requested. Participates in enterprise compliance, risk and assurance initiatives, where necessary. Minimum Requirements Minimum of 3 years of auditing and/or compliance experience within operations, IT or other applicable domains (e.g., Business process controls, IT General Controls, Information Security Controls, Application / Automated Controls). One or more of the following certifications: CPA, CIA, CISA, CISSP, PMP or similar Internal Audit related certification(s). Minimum of 3 years' experience with a Big4, Regional audit firm or large Internal Audit function.  Experience leading teams. Experience executing and leading audits and projects independently.  Preferred Skills Experience presenting audit outcomes and deliverables to senior leadership. Experience auditing Accounting, Finance, Operations and Regulatory domains. Experience leveraging technology-enabled audit techniques (i.e. AI, analytics, automation) and Agile audit methodologies in the execution of audit engagements. Experience auditing Cloud Service platforms and providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, SFDC, Workday) and Cyber Security. Knowledgeable in a variety of the following standards, frameworks and regulations: FFIEC regulations, SOC2 reporting, ISO27001, PCI-DSS, HIPAA, HITECH, NERC, GDPR, and/or NIST-CSF. Demonstrated effectiveness in collaborating and consulting with business partners and other stakeholders on audit related matters. Global Privacy Program Manager  Dell Technologies exists to create technologies that drive human progress. So it’s only natural that a commitment to doing the right thing is at the heart of how we work. Our Global Ethics and Compliance team makes sure we keep our promises. That’s why they created the compliance and integrity program. It helps us to prevent and detect violations of law and other misconduct. Crucially, it also promotes ethical conduct and a commitment to compliance with the law across our global organization. With this team’s efforts, Dell’s integrity is never challenged or compromised.   Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Global Privacy Program Manager on our Global Privacy Team in Round Rock, TX or Hopkinton, Massachusetts. What you’ll achieve In this Global Privacy Program Manager role, you will be a subject matter expert on privacy, driving privacy compliance and guiding privacy support in across the organization. You will work cross-functionally to ensure privacy policies and requirements are implemented across business processes and be a subject matter expert on implementation of privacy by design. Reporting to Dell’s Director of Privacy Management and Compliance, you will implement Privacy Office strategic priorities, proactively identify and manage privacy risks across product group business processes, ensure that Dell operates within the law, and drive adoption of privacy policies, standards, and procedures across the organization. This will include ensuring that processes, projects, applications, systems, processes, and data exchanges are in accordance with Dell’s Code of Conduct, Privacy Policy, Procedures and Standards. You will: Serve as subject matter expert on privacy management and operational and technical implementation of privacy controls, and guide key privacy initiatives and projects Work cross-functionally to develop, embed, and maintain robust privacy controls including privacy by design practices across Dell systems, products, offers and services Conduct and advise on Privacy Impact Assessments of key business initiatives Coordinate with business teams to develop and maintain standards, procedures, and playbooks to ensure compliance and mitigate privacy risk Collaborate on complex strategic projects across teams in and out of the Privacy Office, including privacy lawyers, privacy engineers, product legal, and security teams Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements At least 5-10 years’ experience implementing and advising on privacy compliance, including privacy by design, preferably within the tech industry with a degree or experience in computer science, data science, engineering, cybersecurity, or related field preferred Extensive knowledge of privacy law, regulations, frameworks, and best practices and understanding of global privacy compliance program management Strong technical background with command of IT, software, data analytics, and/or engineering concepts and processes, including development, design, and architecture of IT technology, data handling processes, data flows, and data lifecycle management Experience with privacy risk management across jurisdictions, with ability to apply smart risk and anticipate privacy compliance issues/risks Provided direct support of a business unit or function on privacy issues Desirable Requirements Technical or engineering expertise and experience, including implementation of privacy operational technologies, including experience working in the OneTrust environment, and privacy-enhancing technologies such as state of the art encryption, pseudonymization and anonymization techniques Legal qualification and/or IAPP/CIPP/CIPM/CIPT privacy certifications are a plus Who we are We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. Networking Pre-Sales Engineer At Dell Technologies, we create the extraordinary.  From developing new accounts to driving expansion across existing accounts, our Direct Sales team transforms opportunity into action everyday. Whether focusing on a geography, product line, industry, channel or market segment, their goal is the same: to develop relationships with the end-users of the organization and generate meaningful sales. What you’ll achieve A fantastic opportunity to join one of the most dynamic sales teams in Dell EMC to help drive Network technology solutions in India. you will effectively collaborate with other teams, including the direct sales team, channel, professional services, marketing, finance and other external parties that compliment your pre-sales activities. You will: Sell and design DC & Edge networking solutions around Dell Switches for Govt, Enterprise, SPs, Corporates.  Collaborate with Network Sales Specialist for working on large opportunities. Ability to read through large RFPs and distill the key networking technical compliance asks and match our products and suggest/build the right networking solution will be a key deliverable of this Role.  Engagement with Storage System Engineers to create Networking space around all Storage products we sell, to create new selling space for DC Networking will be desired. (E.g. Powerflex with Dell Switches) Deliver Network pre-sales presentations, demo and PoC to customers and partners as needed. Evangelize new age DC Network transformation story, around SONiC.  Essential Requirements  Expertise and technology understanding for Data Center Networking, Campus Networking, Routing, SDWAN and Security solutions is a must , Knowledge and experience creating access control lists (ACLs) on routers and switches ; r ecent experience using the CLI on major router and switch vendors, hands on implementation experience will be a big positive.  Understanding and Designing and Architecting solutions for Key Industry Trends – Micro-Segmentation, Network Automation, Multi-Site Datacenters, Network Visibility, Multi-Tenant / Network Virtualization, and L4-7 Service Insertion – is a significant part of this role ; a bility to demonstrate a knowledge of networking protocols (TCP/IP, UDP) Working experience with VLANs and IP subnetting & experience using routing protocols such as OSPF and BGP Around 15 years of Networking experience as a service network eng involved in designing/trouble shooting network or as a pre-sales Systems/Sales Engineer and Technical certifications like VCP, CCNA, CCNP, CCIE, JNCP, JNCIA is most desired.  Desirable Requirements  Competitive knowledge of equivalent products and commercial positioning, DC market knowledge will be an added advantage. Experience on SDN, Network automation though Perl/Python/Ansible Scripting and also experience in building network fabric based on BGP-EVPN, VXLAN will be an added advantage. Job Title: 2024 校园招聘  商用客户内部销售客户经理
Job Description: 2024  校园招聘   商用客户内部销售客户经理 即使在数字领域具有开创性的产品也不能做到自我销售。在戴尔，我们下定决心要为每一个客户及合作 伙伴提供高品质的一流体验。这种体验首先从我们开创性的技术产品组合开始，即客户端解决方案、高端电子设备、配件、移动产品、企业解决方案、服务和软件包。内部销售团队为我们的技术产品组合注入了活力。开发持久的关系、建立和谐的环境并依靠自身完美无瑕的交流技巧，通过电话、Web和电子邮件向客户销售产品，这是该团队引以为傲的资本。 欢迎加入我们[厦门]的[内部销售客户经理]在[内部销售]团队，您将与业界顶尖的人员一同共事并产生深远的社会影响。 内部销售客户经理将运用他们的交流技巧与行业知识，通过电话、Web和电子邮件向客户销售公司产品与服务，推动与合作伙伴的合作，最终实现产品解决方案的销售。 关键职责： ·       学习团队合作以及跨部门沟通相关技能，了解和学习世界500强企业领先的管理方式、业务模式和跨团队协作技能。 ·       学习IT前沿技术。包括但不限于：IT数字化转型，云计算、大数据、人工智能，现代化数据中心基础架构等先进解决方案，学习主流解决方案。 ·       提供客户开发至客户维护技能学习；优质的企业培训资源，帮助在时间管理、技能提升、职业规划管理上不断提升 ·       管理客户信息，并通过电话和电子邮件等多种方式与客户建立联系，通过沟通来挖掘客户业务机会 ·       通过团队合作赢取客户订单，并协调订单的交付，学习销售策略，掌握销售流程。 基本要求： ·       良好的沟通能力和学习能力 ·       对销售岗位高度热忱 ·       2024届本科及以上学历优先 戴尔科技集团旗下拥有多家企业，面向客户提供各种创新技术和服务产品组合，旨在助力组织和个人构建数字化未来并实现工作、生活和娱乐方式转型。客户至上、互利共赢、积极创新、追求成效、诚信经营是我们的准则。加入我们独具魅力的大家庭，体验崇尚多元化和包容性的企业文化，享受颇具竞争力的薪酬、奖励方案、优厚福利以及宝贵的学习和发展机会，轻松拓展职业生涯。 了解 我们如何弥合多元化差距。 截止日期：2024年7月 31日 戴尔秉持所有员工工作机会平等的原则，致力于为员工提供⼀个无歧视、无骚扰的工作环境。戴尔的所有雇用决策基于业务需求、工作要求以及资历，与⺠族、肤色、宗教或信仰、国籍、出身或种族、性别（包括怀孕）、年龄、身体、精神或知觉障碍、HIV状况、性取向、性别认同和/或表达、婚姻、民事结合或同居伴侣关系状况、过去或现在的兵役、家族病史或遗传信息、家庭或⽗⺟状况或任何其他受我们运营地点的法律法规保护的状况无关。戴尔决不容忍基于任何上述特征的歧视或骚扰。单击 此处 ，了解有关戴尔多元化和包容性文化的详细信息. Advisor, Client Demand Planning  What gives Dell Technologies our competitive advantage? It’s our ability to achieve cost savings as we operate at the cutting edge of technology. Working in an environment that’s as complex as it is critical, our Materials and Procurement team manages a group of indirect categories, such as real estate, marketing material, supplies or software. We use our in-depth knowledge and experience to develop strategic relationships with external suppliers as well as with key stakeholders. Our role also includes leading contract negotiations, managing risk, driving cost-saving initiatives and implementing strategic sourcing best practices. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a  Advisor  on our Global Commodities Demand Planning team in  Penang, Malaysia . What you’ll achieve As a  D emand Planner , you will analyze and influence the demand and supply position of peripheral commodity to optimize and drive Standard Leadtime and minimize E&O exposure, mainly focus on demand changes, continuity of supply, transition and End of Life commodity management. Understand the Supply Chain capability to influence demand stability and offer recommendations to best utilize available supply. Partner with stakeholders to develop and execute commodity transition plan of product life cycle and minimize customer delivery interruptions. You will: Understand peripheral demand requirement for assigned category at the aggregate level to support all fulfilment models (BTS/BTO/BTP/CTO).                                                    Maintain Continuity of Supply (COS) for assigned peripheral to maintain standard lead time.  Works supply imbalances, both excesses and shortages, with the cross functional group to mitigate the risk as quickly and cost effectively as possible.                                                         Recommend demand shaping opportunities, and work with regional demand planning team /PLM team to establish the demand shaping program.                                                          Governs demand consumption rates and provide early warning and mitigation options to supply issue and manage peripheral oriented transition to avoid transition gap out and E&O Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements >7 years of demand supply relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and work experience.                                         Strong knowledge in demand supply/supply chain management: order management, fulfilment concepts and process, forecast planning and methodology, Lead time and COS management.                                           Competencies:  Excellent analytical skills, communication skills, problem solving and customer first.                                                        Ability to work through ambiguity to complete assigned task, think globally and collaborate with others. Desirable Requirements Power BI skillset would be an added advantage Supply chain operation experience will be an added advantage Here’s our story; now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Job Title: Senior Telecom Services Solutions Architect, APJ
Job Description: Senior   Telecom Services Solutions Architect, APJ When our customers are looking for IT consulting expertise, where else would they turn but to the company driving human progress through technology? Our Solutions Architecture team within Professional Services are experts in package customization and integration as well as total, end-to-end solutions in targeted industry segments. After thorough consultation with our customers and careful analysis, we develop new IT systems or replace existing systems that support customers’ strategic, operational and financial goals. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a  Senior   Telecom Services Solutions Architect   in our Global Inside Presales (DT Select) team in Singapore. What you’ll achieve As a  Senior   Telecom Services Solutions Architect,  you will build solutions catering to the worldwide telecommunications market, which is exploding with new and exciting opportunities offered by new developments such as 5G, Edge Computing, Internet of Things, Open Architecture, and Virtual/Cloud Native Network Functions. With your unique blend of technical expertise, operational excellence, leadership skillset, and business acumen with strong prioritization, facilitation, and communication skills, you will support Telecom customers and Enterprises, as an End to End solutions and services architect in pursuits that will combine Telco Services industry knowledge and technical expertise with innovative thought leadership and strategic guidance.  This role is seeking an individual with understanding & experience with 4G/5G wireless and IT technologies in Virtual/Cloud, Core, Edge, RAN and Transport network design, deployment, system integration, optimization, and network management.  You will: Analyse & Identify Customer Services Objectives/Requirements within Telco RFI/RFP/RFQ & unsolicited bids. Act as the Custom solutioning Telco expert to the sales pursuit strategy; Design Telco Services Solutions that meet customer objectives; Create deliverables, responses and Statements of Work based on the Designed Solution; Own cost modelling and related governance processes for Solution Sign-off. Collaborate cross functionally across Dell’s Telco business unit and participate in all Internal stakeholder meetings (Sales, PMO, Delivery, Partners) to share details of the RFP/RFI, response and answering questions from a Telco perspective. Facilitate customer presentations at senior leadership level or higher Represent DT Select Telco Solutioning within selected Telecom forums. Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements 15 or more years of overall wireless telecom industry experience in a service provider and/or equipment vendor environment, architecting End to End technical, services, integration, and business needs of the 4G/5G wireless networks. Ability to translate customer vision and requirements into technical services and solution for presales motions, service delivery and execution. Strong executive presence and communication skills (written, verbal and presentation) with a proven track record. Demonstrated experience and knowledge across Telco services domains – Deploy, Support, Design, Planning, Consulting, System Integration, and Network Operations. Demonstrated experience to lead cross functional teams and multi geographical locations to develop, communicate and present End to End architectures, services solutions, and strategies to meet the customer’s needs. Desirable Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or relevant discipline with at least 10 years of technical Services pre-sales and architecture experience for large enterprises and Telecom Operators working with global clients on multi-year Network/IT transformational engagements; At least 1 years’ experience working in a service provider organization in the OpenRAN, Virtualization , 5G domains. Program Management and/or Consulting experience desired. PMP is a plus. Who we are We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us. Job Title: Spécialiste 1, Produit intérieur / Specialist 1, Inside Product
Job Description: Spécialiste 1, Inside Product Dell Technologies est un collectif de visionnaires à la pointe de l'industrie et obsédés par le client. Nous pensons que la technologie est essentielle au progrès humain et que la technologie que nous fournissons transforme notre façon de travailler et de vivre. Mais nous sommes plus qu'une entreprise technologique - nous sommes une entreprise humaine. Nous reconnaissons que plus de 100 000 employés répartis sur six continents ont des intérêts et des aspirations différents. Nous inspirons, stimulons et respectons chacun d'entre eux, chaque jour. Et nous leur offrons des possibilités inégalées de croissance et de développement. Nous avons hâte que vous en fassiez l'expérience en tant que représentant commercial au sein de notre équipe de vente canadienne. Notre organisation mondiale de vente interne est un moteur de vente exceptionnel, créatif et efficace sur le plan opérationnel. En tant qu'organisation mondiale, nous fournissons des capacités de vente évolutives et une portée sur le marché pour générer un pipeline et des revenus massifs, tout en développant la prochaine génération de professionnels de la vente et de la technique de Dell Technologies. Chez Dell EMC, nous sommes un leader mondial de la transformation des technologies de l'information et des entreprises. Alors que les entreprises se lancent dans la transformation numérique, Dell EMC aide ses clients à stocker, gérer, protéger et analyser leur actif le plus précieux - l'information - de manière agile, fiable et plus rentable, quels que soient leur secteur et leur segment de marché. Les vendeurs de Dell Technologies sont connus pour leur passion, leur affinité pour l'apprentissage et leur capacité à obtenir des résultats. Académie de vente nouvelle génération Dell Technologies Sur une période de 2 à 3 ans, vous participerez à un programme intensif qui vous préparera à une réussite à long terme au sein de l'organisation commerciale de Dell Technologies. Tous ceux qui rejoignent notre organisation commencent en tant qu'Associate Inside Sales Rep, où ils reçoivent une formation de premier ordre, tant du point de vue technologique que du point de vue commercial. Vous occuperez ce poste pendant 9 à 12 mois, en fonction de vos performances, puis vous aurez la possibilité d'évoluer vers un poste de représentant des ventes internes, où vous devrez atteindre un quota et gérer tous les aspects d'une campagne de vente. En général, les personnes qui occupent le poste de représentant des ventes internes restent un an et demi avant de passer au poste suivant, qu'il s'agisse de vente sur le terrain, de gestion des ventes ou de vente spécialisée. Nous voyons souvent ceux qui réussissent dans ce programme occuper deux ou trois emplois au cours des trois premières années, tous avec plus de responsabilités, une plus grande contribution et un meilleur salaire. Cette opportunité peut vous convenir si vous êtes - passionné, ambitieux et autonome, capable d'établir des relations positives et d'établir des priorités en fonction de demandes changeantes - un leader doté d'une éthique de travail solide - mature, confiant, fiable et adaptable - Vous êtes capable d'influencer les autres et de transmettre un sentiment d'urgence pour résoudre les problèmes En tant qu'ambassadeur de Dell Technologies, vous proposez des solutions à nos clients tout en défendant le message de Dell Technologies avec conviction et passion Faites le premier pas vers la carrière de vos rêves  Chaque membre de l'équipe Dell Technologies apporte quelque chose d'unique. Voici ce que nous recherchons pour ce poste : Exigences essentielles  Diplôme d'associé ou de bachelier avant la date d'entrée en fonction Passionné par une carrière de vendeur dans l'industrie technologique Solides compétences en communication verbale et écrite Vous devez parler couramment le français. Exigences souhaitables  Un leader avec une éthique de travail résiliente, fiable, confiant, motivé et capable d'être encadré Capacité à influencer les autres et à transmettre un sentiment d'urgence pour mener les problèmes à leur terme La culture de travail flexible et hybride de Dell Chez Dell Technologies, nous pensons que c'est en offrant de la flexibilité que nous travaillons le mieux. Nous savons que la liberté et la flexibilité sont essentielles pour tous nos employés, où qu'ils se trouvent, et notre style de travail flexible et hybride permet aux membres de l'équipe d'avoir la liberté d'imaginer, d'innover et d'obtenir des résultats à leur manière. Pour en savoir plus sur notre culture d'entreprise, veuillez consulter notre page sur les lieux de travail. Rémunération Dell s'engage à appliquer des pratiques de rémunération justes et équitables. La fourchette de rémunération pour ce poste est de 72 765 $ à 82 225 $ CAD.  Qui sommes-nous ? Nous croyons que chacun d'entre nous a le pouvoir d'avoir un impact. C'est pourquoi nous plaçons les membres de notre équipe au centre de tout ce que nous faisons. Si vous êtes à la recherche d'une opportunité de faire évoluer votre carrière avec certains des meilleurs cerveaux et des technologies les plus avancées de l'industrie, nous sommes à votre recherche. Dell Technologies est une famille unique d'entreprises qui aide les individus et les organisations à transformer leur façon de travailler, de vivre et de se divertir. Rejoignez-nous pour construire un avenir qui fonctionne pour tout le monde, car le progrès nous concerne tous. Dell Technologies s'engage à respecter le principe de l'égalité des chances en matière d'emploi pour tous les employés et à leur offrir un environnement de travail exempt de discrimination et de harcèlement. Lisez l'intégralité de la politique d'égalité des chances en matière d'emploi ici. Dell Canada Inc. (Dell) est commis à stimuler un environnement inclus et accessible, où tous les employés et clients se sentent évalués, respectés et soutenus. Nous sommes consacrés à établir une main d'oeuvrequi reflète la diversité de nos clients et communautés dans lesquels nous vivons et servons, et créer un environnement où chaque employé a l'occasion d'atteindre elle/son potentiel. Nous faisons bon accueil à des applications de: femmes, personnes indigènes, et personnes avec des incapacités, minorités ethniques, minorités évidentes, et d'autres qui peuvent contribuer à la diversification. En tant qu'élément de notre engagement à l'accessibilité pour toutes les personnes avec des incapacités, Dell veulent, sur la demande du demandeur, fournissent le  logement pendant le processus de recrutement pour assurer l'égalité d'accès aux demandeurs avec des incapacités. Si vous êtes choisi pour une entrevue et vous avez besoin de logement, contactez svp Specialist 1, Inside Product Dell Technologies is a collective of customer-obsessed, industry-leading visionaries. We believe technology is essential to human progress, and the technology we provide transforms the way we work and live. But we are more than a technology company - we are a people company. We recognize that more than 100,000 employees across six continents have different interests and aspirations. We inspire, challenge and respect each and every one of them, every day. And we offer them unrivaled opportunities for growth and development. We can't wait for you to experience it for yourself as a sales representative on our Canadian sales team. At Dell Technologies, we create the extraordinary. Our Inside Product Specialists are the experts who sell innovation to the world. Responsible for a set of products and services, they get to know their portfolio inside and out. Our Inside Sales teams rely on them for technical advice during the sales process. They directly advise customers on everything from product features and configurations, through to pricing and availability. Crucially, however complex the question, they’re ready to deliver technical solutions to meet customers’ needs via phone, chat, web or email. Next Generation Sales Academy Dell Technologies Over a 2-3 year period, you will participate in an intense program that will prepare you for long-term success within the Dell Technologies sales organization. Everyone who joins our organization starts as an Associate Inside Sales Rep where you will receive top-notch training from both a technology and sales perspective. You will be in this role for 9-12 months, depending on your performance, and then you will have the opportunity to progress to an Inside Sales Representative role, where you will be required to meet a quota and manage all aspects of a sales campaign. We typically see people who stay in the inside sales rep role for a year and a half before moving on to their next role, whether it's field sales, sales management, or a sales role. specialized sales. We often see those who succeed in this program work two or three jobs in the first three years, all with more responsibility, greater contribution and bigger pay. This opportunity may be for you if you are someone who is a passionate, ambitious and self-starter, able to build positive relationships and prioritize changing demands leader with a resilient work ethic mature, confident, reliable and adaptable You are able to influence others and convey a sense of urgency to solve problems As an ambassador for Dell Technologies, you offer solutions to our customers while defending the Dell Technologies message with conviction and passion. Take the first step towards your dream career    Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:  Essential Requirements    Completed Associates or Bachelors degree prior to start date  Passionate about a sales career in the technology industry  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Must be Fluent in French Desirable Requirements    A leader with resilient work ethic who is reliable, confident, driven and coachable  Ability to influence others and convey a sense of urgency to drive issues to closure ​  Dell’s Flexible & Hybrid Work Culture   At Dell Technologies, we believe our best work is done when flexibility is offered.  We know that freedom and flexibility are crucial to all our employees no matter where you are located and our flexible and hybrid work style allows team members to have the freedom to ideate, be innovative, and drive results their way. To learn more about our work culture, please visit our  locations  page.     Compensation   Dell is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this position is $72,765 – $82,225 CAD.   Who we are We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you. Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Gather, learn, investigate, and balance software requirements, shaping them into actionable items Write high quality modular software designs Implement great code Define and implement concrete tests and metrics to ensure the definition of done is met. Convey clear and accurate technical documentation and provide long term support Be responsible for improving our stability by troubleshooting and integrating smart solutions to existing components. Help improve development methodologies. Coach peers, partake in and lead design reviews while driving best practices to constantly improve the quality of our product. Help navigate our architecture roadmap. Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Customer Service Apprenticeship Program (SCQF Level 6)  Salary:    £16,200 per annum Duration: 18 months (Fixed Term) Glasgow Not even digitally ground-breaking products sell themselves. At Dell Technologies, we seek to give every one of our customers and partners a high-level, white-glove experience. This begins with our ground-breaking portfolio of products – client solutions, high-end electronics, accessories, mobility products, enterprise solutions, services and packaged software. Our Inside Sales Account Reps breathe life into our technology portfolio. They take great pride in developing lasting relationships, building great rapport and using their flawless communication skills to sell our products to customers by phone, web and email. Demonstrate your commercial sense & talent for selling by joining us as an  Apprentice  on our  Public Sector Sales  team in  Glasgow  to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. What you’ll achieve As a  Customer Service Apprentice  within  Sales , your time will be split between work experience & off the job training with the support of our dedicated training provider.  The apprenticeship is a fantastic opportunity if you are looking to kick start your career & will equip you with everything you need to become a successful sales person You will: During the apprenticeship, you will be learning the skills required to drive sales for our ground-breaking products to a specific account set of  Public Sector  customers. You will build on your confidence to successfully own the brand of Dell Technologies, ensuring every customer interaction is tailored and outstanding. Working to achieve your set targets by developing & building positive relationships with customers through digital communication Using problem solving skills to understand customers’ business & solution requirements to support their current & future technology strategies Growing your knowledge of industry trends to help resolve specific market challenges tailored to your customers Understanding how to build & leverage strong relationships with your sales & cross functional teams to ensure an effective & seamless support function to your customers Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. Commodity Management Advisor A ground-breaking company making game-changing products needs an exceptional supply chain. Commodity Management within Materials and Procurement develops and implements plans to support forecasted needs for suppliers or commodities. We use our in-depth knowledge of foreign and domestic markets to negotiate supplier agreements and contracts with optimum pricing and terms. We also harness our understanding of commodity qualities, transportation options, risk management and supply chain evaluation models to develop optimal commodity management strategies. Join us as a  Commodity Management Advisor  on our  Commodity Management  team in  Penang  to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. What you’ll achieve As a Commodity Management Advisor, you will be responsible for developing and implementing plans to support forecasted needs for supplier and/or commodities; establishing and implementing strategies for negotiating supplier agreements based on in-depth knowledge of foreign and domestic markets for optimum pricing and terms. You will: • Direct cross functional teams to drive commodity metrics, strategies and goals while conducting risk analysis and recommending mitigation strategies • Develop and gain business buy in for complex RFQ, making supply chain optimization recommendations • Drive resolutions for issues within the supplier, negotiating product cost and contracts, as well as identifying cost savings • Identify, track and monitor new technology development and support supplier integration • Developing and maintain relationships with key suppliers, creating new relationship to meet supply chain needs Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Job Title: Server Procurement Purchasing Senior Analyst (Cost Analyst)
Job Description: Server Procurement Purchasing Senior Analyst (Cost Analyst) Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company - we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 150,000 employees across the globe. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We can't wait for you to discover this for yourself as a  Purchasing Senior Analyst  on our  Server Procurement and Operations team  in  Penang, Malaysia. Our products drive human progress. Our Purchasing team drives the progress of our supply systems. We lead strategic and operational commodity teams, while developing supplier strategy, long-range plans and the optimization of the global supply chain. Our remit includes setting delivery performance goals and implementing procurement initiatives and process improvements. We also oversee the planning and obtaining of materials, components, equipment and services for all parts of the business, including checking requisitions, developing new supply sources and ensuring best quality at best value from third parties. Function Description: Dell's is one of the Best Run Supply Chain's in the world - renowned for its efficiency and speed of execution. Dell pioneered the Dell Direct Model enabled by a supply chain that generated significant cost and speed efficiencies. Over the last few years, Dell has enabled numerous other sales channels including retail and manufacturing with partner ODMs. The Dell Supply Chain is getting transformed with multiple nodes of manufacturing and fulfilment to service demands from different customer segments. The key objective is to help Dell's global operations to streamline processes, cut costs and improve efficiencies. The team has a very strong pool of talent coming from premier schools and industries and possesses diverse expertise and skillsets. It's the place to be for "work hard, play hard". Key Responsibilities: Will work within broader Procurement/Global Operations organization with stakeholders from Finance and related functional team to run spend analytics and highlight opportunities and focus categories for cost reduction and validate cost components of each Line of Business (LOB) to ensure accuracy. Roll up bill of materials (BOM) cost for assigned platforms, validate embedded cost components, report and fix the discrepancies by working with platform Global Commodity Manager (GCM), sub-tier GCMs and ODMs Manage supply chain resiliency cost analytics including payment reconciliation with Finance, GCM and suppliers and support supply chain resiliency related cost outlook, manage monthly/quarterly cost loading and Cost Interlock (CI) submission to Finance. Support variance analysis for actual vs outlook and summarize findings to management for reviews.  Participate in supply chain resiliency enablement project inbusiness requirements, user acceptance testing (UAT) and lead change management within Cost Analyst teams (CA) and GCM and review and drive improvement in Purchase Price Variance (PPV) and reconcile the cost differential.    Support analysis on gap to Clean Sheet, BOM cost, Total Available Market (TAM) allocation, cost forecast, Non-Recurring Expense (NRE) etc Analyze complex business problems and issues using data to provide insight to critical business decisions, integrate data from multiple sources to produce requested or required data elements and ensure the most effective use of existing business systems and process to meet business result and organization goal Creatively visualize and effectively communicate data findings and insights in a variety of formats with limited supervision, provides project support, cost management and development support of commodity supplier strategy. Involve in project to design, develop and deploy of new tools, process enhancement with goal to drive efficiency in daily operation and identified opportunities for standardization and simplification across CI processes currently in place.  Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements • 5 to 6 years of related experience from jobs with emphasis on data analytics, problem-solving, with good attention to detail and have a very strong aptitude for standard software applications (Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint) • Basic understanding of global supply chain, manufacturing footprint and business environment and ability to work independently with business stakeholders to understand the business problem and identifying the approach to solving the business problem using advanced analytic techniques • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and good interpersonal, presentation skills & project management skills •  Persistent : You will be asked to solve ambiguous problems with no clear owners in a giant organization. You will run into walls and in circles, but you need to stay determined.  Passionate : True interest in learning about operations and how products are made and delivered – only then, will you truly be persistent in the face of major challenges.  Paranoid : Supply chain is all about identifying and mitigating unknown risks. Job Title: Server Procurement Purchasing Senior Analyst (Cost Analyst)
Job Description: Server Procurement Purchasing Senior Analyst (Cost Analyst) Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company - we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 150,000 employees across the globe. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We can't wait for you to discover this for yourself as a  Purchasing Senior Analyst  on our  Server Procurement and Operations team  in  Penang, Malaysia. Our products drive human progress. Our Purchasing team drives the progress of our supply systems. We lead strategic and operational commodity teams, while developing supplier strategy, long-range plans and the optimization of the global supply chain. Our remit includes setting delivery performance goals and implementing procurement initiatives and process improvements. We also oversee the planning and obtaining of materials, components, equipment and services for all parts of the business, including checking requisitions, developing new supply sources and ensuring best quality at best value from third parties. Function Description: Dell's is one of the Best Run Supply Chain's in the world - renowned for its efficiency and speed of execution. Dell pioneered the Dell Direct Model enabled by a supply chain that generated significant cost and speed efficiencies. Over the last few years, Dell has enabled numerous other sales channels including retail and manufacturing with partner ODMs. The Dell Supply Chain is getting transformed with multiple nodes of manufacturing and fulfilment to service demands from different customer segments. The key objective is to help Dell's global operations to streamline processes, cut costs and improve efficiencies. The team has a very strong pool of talent coming from premier schools and industries and possesses diverse expertise and skillsets. It's the place to be for "work hard, play hard". Key Responsibilities: Will work within broader Procurement/Global Operations organization with stakeholders from Finance and related functional team to run spend analytics and highlight opportunities and focus categories for cost reduction and validate cost components of each Line of Business (LOB) to ensure accuracy. Roll up bill of materials (BOM) cost for assigned platforms, validate embedded cost components, report and fix the discrepancies by working with platform Global Commodity Manager (GCM), sub-tier GCMs and ODMs Manage supply chain resiliency cost analytics including payment reconciliation with Finance, GCM and suppliers and support supply chain resiliency related cost outlook, manage monthly/quarterly cost loading and Cost Interlock (CI) submission to Finance. Support variance analysis for actual vs outlook and summarize findings to management for reviews.  Participate in supply chain resiliency enablement project inbusiness requirements, user acceptance testing (UAT) and lead change management within Cost Analyst teams (CA) and GCM and review and drive improvement in Purchase Price Variance (PPV) and reconcile the cost differential.    Support analysis on gap to Clean Sheet, BOM cost, Total Available Market (TAM) allocation, cost forecast, Non-Recurring Expense (NRE) etc Analyze complex business problems and issues using data to provide insight to critical business decisions, integrate data from multiple sources to produce requested or required data elements and ensure the most effective use of existing business systems and process to meet business result and organization goal Creatively visualize and effectively communicate data findings and insights in a variety of formats with limited supervision, provides project support, cost management and development support of commodity supplier strategy. Involve in project to design, develop and deploy of new tools, process enhancement with goal to drive efficiency in daily operation and identified opportunities for standardization and simplification across CI processes currently in place.  Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements • 5 to 6 years of related experience from jobs with emphasis on data analytics, problem-solving, with good attention to detail and have a very strong aptitude for standard software applications (Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint) • Basic understanding of global supply chain, manufacturing footprint and business environment and ability to work independently with business stakeholders to understand the business problem and identifying the approach to solving the business problem using advanced analytic techniques • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and good interpersonal, presentation skills & project management skills •  Persistent : You will be asked to solve ambiguous problems with no clear owners in a giant organization. You will run into walls and in circles, but you need to stay determined.  Passionate : True interest in learning about operations and how products are made and delivered – only then, will you truly be persistent in the face of major challenges.  Paranoid : Supply chain is all about identifying and mitigating unknown risks. You need to be thinking ahead of everyone else about the next risk on the horizon Desirable Requirements • Previous working experience in Supply Chain or Procurement, Global Operations Finance, FP&A • Knowledge in Advanced Excel and/or Access skills (VBA, macros, Power BI etc) Who we are   We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. Job Title: Estágio de Suporte Vendas de Serviços
Job Description: Estágio de Suporte Vendas de Serviços Nossa equipe de suporte às operações de vendas está no centro do desenvolvimento de processos operacionais e procedimentos para administração, atendimento e comunicação de pedidos on-line e off-line. Criando uma ponte entre as vendas realizadas por profissionais de vendas e outras funções operacionais, usamos nossas habilidades para avaliar e implementar melhorias em programas de vendas e processos: do planejamento e priorização, às estratégias de margem e preços, automação de vendas, criação de relatórios e muito mais. Buscamos garantir que o processo de oferecer nossos produtos e serviços inovadores aos clientes seja o mais rápido e simples possível.  Junte-se a nós, desempenhe o melhor trabalho da sua carreira e cause um impacto social profundo como  Estagiário(a) de Suporte Vendas de Serviços  na nossa equipe de  Operações de Vendas  em  São Paulo . Secureworks (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a global cybersecurity leader that secures human progress with Secureworks® Taegis™, a SaaS-based, open XDR platform built on 20+ years of real-world threat intelligence and research, improving customers’ ability to detect advanced threats, streamline and collaborate on investigations, and automate the right actions. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team. Role Overview The Incident Response Consultant is primarily focused on the delivery of emergency incident response services. This involves supporting customers by managing the  technical and non-technical aspects of incident response, conducting investigative analysis using digital forensics methods to determine the nature, scope, and root cause of cyber incident activity, formulating recommendations for security posture enhancement, and developing tailored remediation plans. Additionally, the Incident Response Consultant may be required to deliver a range of proactive incident response services. These services include cyber threat hunting to help customers identify unknown compromise activity and gaps in their cybersecurity controls, as well as workshops, training courses, and exercises to help customers improve their incident response capabilities. Role Responsibilities: Serve as subject matter expert in digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) Perform complex incident response investigative analysis and develop assessments based on the analysis of host, network, and cloud digital artifacts Document analysis findings and develop recommendations to present both orally and in written reports to customers Develop tailored incident response remediation plans for major cyber incidents to direct customer containment and recovery efforts Manage urgent and critical interactions with customers Maintain professional, calming, and authoritative presence during a crisis Participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation for supporting requests from global incident response customers Travel as needed to assist customers with on-site incident response efforts This is a remote position that requires up to 10% travel. Working schedule: Friday to Monday, 11 - 22 or 12 - 23.    Requirements: Minimum five (5) years of cybersecurity experience in complex operating environments Minimum three (3) years in a customer facing support role (Security Engineer, Client Services, Consulting, Professional Services) Minimum of two (2) years of host forensics, network forensics, and cloud forensics experience for threat hunting and incident response efforts GCIH, GCFE, GCFA, GREM or similar certifications Strong communication skills (oral and written) Experience briefing senior-level leadership and conveying technical information to audiences of varying backgrounds and skill levels Ability to prioritize urgent tasks and work multiple consulting engagements concurrently Desire to work with customers to solve complex cybersecurity issues, including during crisis situations Theoretical and practical knowledge in the following areas: Windows and Linux operating systems AWS, Azure (including Microsoft 365), and GCP Exploits, vulnerabilities, intrusion vectors, and malware Tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) commonly employed by threat actors Host forensics, network forensics, and malware analysis techniques Network traffic analysis, endpoint activity analysis, and log analysis techniques Enterprise cyber incident management and response processes Enterprise cybersecurity controls and failure modes Modern Enterprise Detection and Response (EDR) tools. Job Title: 2024 校园招聘 商用客户内部销售实习生
Job Description: 即使在数字领域具有开创性的产品也不能做到自我销售。在戴尔，我们下定决心要为每一个客户及合作   伙伴提供高品质的一流体验。这种体验首先从我们开创性的技术产品组合开始，即客户端解决方案、高端电子设备、配件、移动产品、企业解决方案、服务和软件包。内部销售团队为我们的技术产品组合注入了活力。开发持久的关系、建立和谐的环境并依靠自身完美无瑕的交流技巧，通过电话、 Web 和电子邮件向客户销售产品，这是该团队引以为傲的资本 。 欢迎加入我们 [大连] 的 [内部销售 实习生 ] 在 [ 内部销售 ] 团队，您将与业界顶尖的人员一同共事并产生深远的社会影响 。 内部销售实习生将运用他们的交流技巧与行业知识，通过电话、 Web 和电子邮件向客户销售公司产品与服务，推动与合作伙伴的合作，最终实现产品解决方案的销售 。 关键职责 ： ·         学习团队合作以及跨部门沟通相关技能，了解和学习世界 500 强企业领先的管理方式、业务模式和跨团队协作技能 。 ·         学习 IT 前沿技术。包括但不限于： IT 数字化转型，云计算、大数据、人工智能，现代化数据中心基础架构等先进解决方案，学习主流解决方案 。 ·         提供客户开发至客户维护技能学习；优质的企业培训资源，帮助在时间管理、技能提升、职业规划管理上不断提 升 ·         管理客户信息，并通过电话和电子邮件等多种方式与客户建立联系，通过沟通来挖掘客户业务机 会 ·         通过团队合作赢取客户订单，并协调订单的交付，学习销售策略，掌握销售流程 。 基本要求 ： ·         良好的沟通能力和学习能 力 ·         对销售岗位高度热 忱 ·         2025  届本科及以上学历优 先 戴尔科技集团旗下拥有多家企业，面向客户提供各种创新技术和服务产品组合，旨在助力组织和个人构建数字化未来并实现工作、生活和娱乐方式转型。客户至上、互利共赢、积极创新、追求成效、诚信经营是我们的准则。加入我们独具魅力的大家庭，体验崇尚多元化和包容性的企业文化，享受颇具竞争力的薪酬、奖励方案、优厚福利以及宝贵的学习和发展机会，轻松拓展职业生涯。 了解 我们如何弥合多元化差距 。 截止日期： 2024 年 6 月  30 日 戴尔秉持所有员工工作机会平等的原则，致力于为员工提供 ⼀个无歧视、无骚扰的工作环境。戴尔的所有雇用决策基于业务需求、工作要求以及资历，与⺠族、肤色、宗教或信仰、国籍、出身或种族、性别（包括怀孕）、年龄、身体、精神或知觉障碍、 HIV 状况、性取向、性别认同和 / 或表达、婚姻、民事结合或同居伴侣关系状况、过去或现在的兵役、家族病史或遗传信息、家庭或 ⽗⺟状况或任何其他受我们运营地点的法律法规保护的状况无关。戴尔决不容忍基于任何上述特征的歧视或骚扰。单 击 此处 ，了解有关戴尔多元化和包容性文化的详细信息 Job ID: R228781 Dell’s Flexible & Hybrid Work Culture At Dell Technologies, we believe our best work is done when flexibility is offered. Secureworks (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a global cybersecurity leader that secures human progress with Secureworks® Taegis™, a SaaS-based, open XDR platform built on 20+ years of real-world threat intelligence and research, improving customers’ ability to detect advanced threats, streamline and collaborate on investigations, and automate the right actions. Be part of an exciting team that deals with bleeding-edge information security attacks, malware infections, and incident response situations on a daily basis. Protecting our clients from threat actors attempting to compromise their environments. Working as a Cyber security DevOps analyst involves the use of Python, Pandas data analytics, Jupyter Notebooks and Bash scripting to automate routine tasks and improve efficiency and reduce incident response time. Additionally, the role requires expertise in interfacing with a variety of security-related APIs for debug and integration purposes into our security ecosystem. The Cybersecurity Analyst is expected to work with software developers and engineers ensuring that development processes are adhered to and the software functions as intended. A core part of the role is identifying, investigating, and resolving security incidents. This needs to be executed with an advanced understanding of attacker methodologies and tactics. Role Responsibilities Review security-related events and assess their risk and validity based on available telemetry from network, endpoint, and global threat intelligence information in order to identify good use cases for automation playbooks. Apply Python scripting, Pandas data analysis and bash scripting skills to automate routine tasks and enhance the efficiency of security operations. Develop and implement automation playbooks and AI solutions to improve incident response time and SOC efficiency. API Integration: Interface with various security-related APIs, such as Microsoft Graph, Azure Sentinel, Virustotal, Urlscan, and others, for debugging and integration into our security ecosystem. Working with software developers and software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended. Identify, investigate, and resolve security incidents while applying advanced understanding of attacker methodologies and tactics. Qualifications Proven experience as a Cybersecurity Analyst working in a security operations center (Security analysis or incident response or threat hunting). Excellent knowledge and hands-on experience with Python and Python libraries, particularly Pandas. Experience in utilizing and troubleshooting APIs for system integration. Deep understanding of IT incident response frameworks. Knowledge of AI and automation playbooks integration in a SOC. Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team. Skills and Abilities Ability to write scripts to automate new and existing tasks. Good threat hunting mindset to easily identify the most relevant information from large contexts of data. Strong technical communication skills, both written and verbal. Risk assessment and decision making The ability to analyze within reason facts and situations, decision making, evaluating consequences of others and undertake acceptable risks. Influencing - the ability to convince others of his opinions and determine them to follow. Task management and planning - The ability to effectively set an adequate action plan for himself/herself and for others, to reach a goal. Responding to incidents includes helping customers manage technical and non-technical aspects of managing response to complex, large-scale incidents; conducting detailed technical analysis to  identify  the scope and  magnitude  security incident activity, develop timelines of activity, develop remediation recommendations and plans.     The Incident Response Senior Advisor works with incident responders, security analysts, and customers in the growing area of cybersecurity incident response management. This role  operates  as a key member of an incident response team delivering emergency services focused on management of active Managed Extended Detection and Response (MXDR) incident response engagements. Responding to incidents includes helping customers manage technical and non-technical aspects of managing response to complex, large-scale incidents; conducting detailed technical analysis to  identify  the scope and  magnitude  security incident activity, develop timelines of activity, develop remediation recommendations, mitigation plans, and incident reporting.     Role Responsibilities     Team member will  operate  as  initial  escalation path for incident response escalations originating from  Secureworks  MXDR service   Review security-related events and assess their risk and validity based on available telemetry from network, endpoint, and global threat intelligence information to provide customers with concise, detailed, and well-written incident reports, root causes identification, and remediation recommendations   Perform technical analysis and develop technical conclusions based on analysis of evidence   Serve as subject matter expert in incident response and digital forensics   Perform complex incident response technical analysis and develop technical conclusions based on analysis of evidence; review analysis and conclusions of other consultants   Document findings and develop incident response remediation recommendations to present both orally and in written reports for customers   Develop playbooks based on customer needs   Use the  Secureworks  platform to proactively hunt for and investigate activity within the customer environment     Requirements     6+ years of advanced security and forensic experience with two or more major operating systems: Microsoft: 8, 8.1, 7, Vista, XP, Server, 2012, 2008, 2003, 2000; OS X; Unix; Solaris and Linux variants; iOS; Android   Familiarity with  Jupyter  notebooks and python development for forensic analysis   Strong security analysis skills of networking data and traffic   Understanding of threat hunting methodologies using both endpoint and network-based telemetry   Strong experience with multiple forensic tools (such as Encase, FTK, X-Ways, F-Response, Volatility, Blacklight,  MacQuisition , Recon)   Operational experience with security tools (firewalls, IDS, IPS, SIEMs, proxies, VPNs)   Understanding of vulnerabilities and tools used to discover/ analyse /exploit vulnerabilities (Nessus, Nmap, Metasploit)   Ability to  utilize  Markdown markup language to document analysis findings and  provide  results to customer in an organized manner   Strong technical communication skills (oral and written) including experience briefing executive management and desire to work with customers to solve complex security issues, including at times in crisis situations   Understanding of at least one Compliance Framework Experience: ISO 27001/2, FISMA, PCI, HITRUST, NIST 800-series,  CoBIT Ability to have consultative conversations with the customer focused on service delivery concepts, processes, and technical investigations        Preferred Skills     8+ years of information security experience.   1+ years of Python development with  Jupyter  notebook experience   Bachelor's degree, preferably in computer science, information systems, information assurance;
