The Principal Consultant ANZ is a key player at the intersection of technical leadership and client-facing sales in the region. You will be responsible for representing Secureworks’ strategy & vision, while ensuring these align with the specific needs of our customers and partners in the region. Key Responsibilities Strategic Technology Leadership: Through having a keen interest in evolving market and broad technology dynamics and through close consultation with our customers and partners, understand and articulate how we can best meet them where they are today in their mission to better operationalise their security programs. Customer Engagement and Advisory: Act as a senior advisor to customers and partners, helping them to understand and implement complex cybersecurity solutions tailored to their specific business contexts. Partner engagement: Actively develop partner network and technical alliances across the region. Technical Sales Support: Collaborate with the sales team to provide expert technical support in the sales process, including product demonstrations, presentations, and technical consultations. Solution Development and Customisation: Work closely with product development teams to guide the creation of innovative cybersecurity solutions and customise existing products to meet regional market needs. Market Trend Analysis: Continuously analyse emerging technology trends, cybersecurity threats, and the competitive landscape in the ANZ region. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Foster collaboration across sales, marketing, product development, and engineering teams to ensure cohesive and effective delivery of cybersecurity solutions. Customer Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with customers, acting as a trusted technical and strategic advisor. Technical Mentoring and Training: Provide mentorship and training to both technical teams and sales staff, enhancing their cybersecurity knowledge and skills. Skills & Qualifications Proven experience in cybersecurity, with a strong understanding of the ANZ market. Demonstrated ability in strategic planning and technology leadership. Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate complex technical challenges into business solutions. Experience in technical sales, customer management, and product development. Leadership qualities with the ability to mentor and guide teams. This role is ideal for an individual who is passionate about cybersecurity, enjoys the challenge of solving complex problems, and thrives in a role that blends technical expertise with strategic business acumen and client engagement. Job Title: 2024 暑期实习 企业客户经理
Job Description: 2024 暑期实习   企业客户经理 即使在数字领域具有开创性的产品也不能做到自我销售。在戴尔，我们下定决心要为每一个客户及合作   伙伴提供高品质的一流体验。这种体验首先从我们开创性的技术产品组合开始，即客户端解决方案、高端电子设备、配件、移动产品、企业解决方案、服务和软件包。内部销售团队为我们的技术产品组合注入了活力。开发持久的关系、建立和谐的环境并依靠自身完美无瑕的交流技巧，通过电话、 Web 和电子邮件向客户销售产品，这是该团队引以为傲的资本。 欢迎加入我们 [ 厦门 ] 的 [企业客户经理] 在 [ 内部销售 ] 团队，您将与业界顶尖的人员一同共事并产生深远的社会影响。 内部销售实习生将运用他们的交流技巧与行业知识，通过电话、 Web 和电子邮件向客户销售公司产品与服务，推动与合作伙伴的合作，最终实现产品解决方案的销售。 关键职责： ·         学习团队合作以及跨部门沟通相关技能，了解和学习世界 500 强企业领先的管理方式、业务模式和跨团队协作技能。 ·         学习 IT 前沿技术。包括但不限于： IT 数字化转型，云计算、大数据、人工智能，现代化数据中心基础架构等先进解决方案，学习主流解决方案。 ·         提供客户开发至客户维护技能学习；优质的企业培训资源，帮助在时间管理、技能提升、职业规划管理上不断提升 ·         管理客户信息，并通过电话和电子邮件等多种方式与客户建立联系，通过沟通来挖掘客户业务机会 ·         通过团队合作赢取客户订单，并协调订单的交付，学习销售策略，掌握销售流程。 基本要求： ·         良好的沟通能力和学习能力 ·         对销售岗位高度热忱 ·        2025  届本科及以上学历优先 我们是谁： 我们相信，我们每个人都有能力产生影响。这就是为什么我们将团队成员置于我们所做的一切的中心。如果您正在寻找机会与业内最优秀的人才和最先进的技术一起发展您的职业生涯，我们正在寻找您。   戴尔科技集团是一个独特的商业集成，可帮助个人和组织转变工作、生活和娱乐方式。加入我们，建立一个适合所有人的未来，因为进步需要我们所有人。 截止日期：2024年  6月  30日 戴尔科技集团致力于为所有员工提供平等就业机会的原则，并为员工提供没有歧视和骚扰的工作环境。阅读完整的平等就业机会政策请点击 这里 。 Job ID: R228536 Dell’s Flexible & Hybrid Work Culture At Dell Technologies, we believe our best work is done when flexibility is offered. Job Posting Secureworks (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a global cybersecurity leader that secures human progress with Secureworks® Taegis™, a SaaS-based, open XDR platform built on 20+ years of real-world threat intelligence and research, improving customers’ ability to detect advanced threats, streamline and collaborate on investigations, and automate the right actions. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team. Role Overview Be part of an exciting team that deals with bleeding-edge information security attacks, malware infections, and incident response situations on a daily basis. Protecting our clients from threat actors attempting to compromise their environments. Working as a Senior Advisor in a security operations center environment with other security and networking professionals, you will extend your currently existing network and endpoint security investigation analysis skillset through identification, assessment, review and authoring of incident reports in a variety of client environments. You will actively investigate threat actor activity, malware infections, living off the land attacks, as well as a variety of other security incidents and provide clients with the impact of the threat, your assessment of the incident, as well as recommendations. Role Responsibilities Review security-related events and assess their risk and validity based on available telemetry from network, endpoint, and global threat intelligence information in order to provide clients with concise, detailed, and well-written incident reports, root causes identification, and remediation recommendations. Provide customers with understandable context around their security environment and threats. Interface with clients to address their issues, concerns, and questions, and drive to satisfactory closure any issues that impact the service and its value. Work with client and internal Secureworks incident response teams to resolve ongoing intrusions, malware outbreaks, and other security incidents. Provide mentorship to Secureworks team members and clients on security strategy, tactics, techniques, and procedures. Use the Secureworks platform to proactively hunt for and investigate activity within the client environment. Use experience gained during incident investigations as well as malware and exploit analysis to contribute to the development of indicators of compromise. Act as first point of coordination for escalations coming on shift directly from customers via chat, tickets, investigations, (with support from manager). Act as shift coordinator by prioritizing the tasks, activities, internal and external client’s requests. Provide support for all other teams involved in the delivery of the service whenever they have questions or requests from customers. Collect and validate  flows/processes/tools  issues reported by his shift and present them to the manager. Involve in technical assessments, coaching and/or development of training programs for the team members. Tracking and reporting of KPIs Requirements Experience, Skills and Abilities Significant experience with and expert understanding of: Two (2) or more of the following operating systems (Windows, Linux, Mac OS) at a filesystem level. Fundamental Internet protocols, services and technologies (e.g. HTTP/HTTPS, DNS, SMTP, SSH, LDAP, TCP/IP, UDP, ICMP, JSON, REST, etc.). Common security controls (e.g. firewalls, proxies, IDS/IPS, WAF, etc.). Experience with and strong understanding of: Performing both endpoint and network-based investigations. Reviewing logs to identify evidence of past intrusions. Pivot off indicators within networks to identify the scope and breadth of attacks. Malware and exploit kit functionality. Operating system and application exploits. Lateral movement, living-off-the-land, and persistence establishment mechanisms. Detection of anomalous system activity. Threat hunting methodologies. Incident response and incident handling processes. Skills and/or abilities required to perform the essential functions of the job: Ability to research and characterize security threats including creating appropriate countermeasures. Ability to write scripts to automate new and existing tasks. Strong technical communication skills, both written and verbal. Attention to detail and great organizational and time management skills. Excellent problem solving skills that would allow for the ability to diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues. Client-focused with a passion for delivering service excellence. Courage and willingness to challenge conventional wisdom. Great leadership and coaching skills. Communication - The ability to make himself well understood by others through the capacity to clearly and convincing express his point of view, to actively listen and control the conversation flow). Risk assessment and decision making -The ability to analyze within reason facts and situations, decision making, evaluating consequences of others and undertake acceptable risks. Influencing - the ability to convince others of his opinions and determine them to follow. Task management and planning - The ability to effectively set an adequate action plan for himself/herself and for others, in order to reach a goal. Strong sense of urgency and ability to work under pressure. Possess high standard of integrity and confidentiality. Education/Experience 5 + years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and work experience: Completion of a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent program in Computer Science, Network Security, Information Security or other applicable field and 5+ years of work experience in the field. Certifications Industry certification from vendors: ISC2, GIAC, EC-Council, Cisco, Juniper, CompTIA, ITIL, Unix, Microsoft, Oracle, etc. (eg: GCIA, GWAPT, GCIH, GCFA/GCFE, GREM, OSCP/OSCE, eLearn THP or similar certification preferred). Language English - Very strong verbal and written skills. Location Bucharest Work schedule Rotating shifts (12h Shifts) Secureworks is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Secureworks will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Role Overview As a Senior Software Quality Automation Engineer, you will be a key member of an exciting product development initiative. You will be responsible for performing software testing in a multi-platform environment using cutting-edge technology, including installed security agents, cloud services and microservices. We protect our customers by disrupting attacker tradecraft so we can deny them access to the networks we protect. This is a challenging and also very rewarding position where interesting projects in security are implemented in order to protect our clients from Internet intrusions. The ideal applicant must have strong communication skills, solid analytical and problem solving skills and in-depth knowledge of software automated testing and best practices. Applicant must be highly motivated and willing to work in a team environment with very talented individuals on complex, early-stage development projects.   Role Responsibilities: Help design, implement and perform full lifecycle software testing, and actively find ways to break the product while testing it Ensure code quality by verifying software behavior (manual/exploratory, blackbox and automation testing) Work closely with software engineers and architects to ensure complete and accurate software testing. Evaluate new software testing technologies for appropriateness. Identify and propose solutions for existing QA gaps. Work with GITLab and other development automated build and code repository frameworks Work with developers to identify, track and fix bugs. Perform software testing in an Agile/SCRUM environment.   Required Skills and Experience: Five (5) or more years of experience in Quality Assurance (Automation, Manual, System, Component, End to End Testing) Three (3) or more years of experience writing automated scripts in Python, Go, Java, C/C++, JavaScript, or similar. Three (3) or more years of experience utilizing automation frameworks such as: Robot Framework, Cypress, Cucumber, Capybara and/or SoapUI. Two (2) or more years of OS Level / Kernel level agent testing experience. Experience testing security applications.  Experience with trace and logging debugging.  Experience writing Windows-native scripting (.bat or .cmd scripting and PowerShell scripting) Experience designing and automating system/end-to-end test scenarios. Experience designing test strategies and test plans. Excellent team, communication and organizational skills Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent   Preferred Skills and Experience: Experience with Python, HTML5, JavaScript, Cypress, Node JS/Angular is a plus Experience with being a tester in the network engineering domain is a plus Experience designing and implementing custom automation frameworks is a plus Experience with GITLab and other development automated build and code repository frameworks Experience working on Agile/Scrum teams and/or Startup-like environments. Experience testing microservices in containerized environments (Docker-compose, K8s) Experience working with remote teams. The agent plays the crucial role of detecting malicious behavior and other activities to feed data into the cloud for further threat analysis. With the help of threat intelligence gathered by our world class security researchers and powered by amazing threat analytics platform we are able to detect threats and secure our clients infrastructure. We are looking for a Senior Principal Software Engineer with good knowledge of Windows systems to drive the next-generation endpoint capabilities of our new product offerings. You will work in a fast-paced, startup-like environment with an experienced, cross-functional team of software engineers, data scientists, and security experts to develop our next generation endpoint sensor that seamlessly integrates with our cloud-native security analytics platform. If you love computer security and digging into complex engineering challenges, then we want your help securing human progress! Role Responsibilities Design and Develop software with high concurrency and reliability requirements and low/no impact to end users. Project technical leadership and participate in designing the architecture, strategy, and development of next generation threat detection and response capabilities. Follow Test-driven Development and design/implement with cross platform deliverables (Linux, macOS, Windows). Triage, reproduce, debug, and fix issues identified in the product. Build tools to support team efficiency and contribute to test automation. Ensure high standards are being followed when it comes to design, coding quality, along with unit and component testing. Work effectively on a geographically distributed team to deliver high quality software against aggressive schedules. Minimum Requirements Strong experience and knowledge with C++ (17/20/22). Proven experience in writing File System minifilter driver Proficiency in Windows OS User-mode and Kernel-mode Development. Solid knowledge with low-level OS internals and experience with Win32 APIs. Experience in debugging and solving application crashes, performance optimization. Experience developing applications using concurrency with the use of strong multi-threading. Preferred Skills Strong command with modern C++. Good knowledge and experience working with WFP filters Experience with Malware research and reverse engineering. Experience with software security areas including encryption, authentication, offensive and/or defensive techniques. OS system expertise for core concepts and subsystems. Secureworks (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a global cybersecurity leader that secures human progress with Secureworks® Taegis™, a SaaS-based, open XDR platform built on 20+ years of real-world threat intelligence and research, improving customers’ ability to detect advanced threats, streamline and collaborate on investigations, and automate the right actions. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team. Role Overview Taegis Endpoint Agent is cross-platform product and a vital part of our XDR platform. The agent plays the crucial role of detecting malicious behavior and other activities to feed data into the cloud for further threat analysis. With the help of threat intelligence gathered by our world class security researchers and powered by amazing threat analytics platform we are able to detect threats and secure our clients infrastructure. We are looking for a Senior Principal Software Engineer with good knowledge of Windows systems to drive the next-generation endpoint capabilities of our new product offerings. You will work in a fast-paced, startup-like environment with an experienced, cross-functional team of software engineers, data scientists, and security experts to develop our next generation endpoint sensor that seamlessly integrates with our cloud-native security analytics platform. If you love computer security and digging into complex engineering challenges, then we want your help securing human progress! Role Responsibilities Design and Develop software with high concurrency and reliability requirements and low/no impact to end users. Project technical leadership and participate in designing the architecture, strategy, and development of next generation threat detection and response capabilities. Follow Test-driven Development and design/implement with cross platform deliverables (Linux, macOS, Windows). Triage, reproduce, debug, and fix issues identified in the product. Build tools to support team efficiency and contribute to test automation. Ensure high standards are being followed when it comes to design, coding quality, along with unit and component testing. Work effectively on a geographically distributed team to deliver high quality software against aggressive schedules. Minimum Requirements Strong experience and knowledge with C++ (17/20/22). Proficiency in Windows OS User-mode and Kernel-mode Development. Solid knowledge with low-level OS internals and experience with Win32 APIs. Experience in debugging and solving application crashes, performance optimization. Experience developing applications using concurrency with the use of strong multi-threading. Proven experience in writing File System minifilter driver. Preferred Skills Strong command with modern C++. Experience with Malware research and reverse engineering. Experience with software security areas including encryption, authentication, offensive and/or defensive techniques. OS system expertise for core concepts and subsystems. Familiarity and experience with Agile process. Knowledge in Security. Experience working with Cloud applications. Good knowledge and experience working with WFP filters. Job Title: 2024 校园招聘 商用客户内部销售实习生
Job Description: 2024  校园招聘   商用客户内部销售实习 生 即使在数字领域具有开创性的产品也不能做到自我销售。在戴尔，我们下定决心要为每一个客户及合作   伙伴提供高品质的一流体验。这种体验首先从我们开创性的技术产品组合开始，即客户端解决方案、高端电子设备、配件、移动产品、企业解决方案、服务和软件包。内部销售团队为我们的技术产品组合注入了活力。开发持久的关系、建立和谐的环境并依靠自身完美无瑕的交流技巧，通过电话、 Web 和电子邮件向客户销售产品，这是该团队引以为傲的资本 。 欢迎加入我们 [ 厦门 ] 的 [内部销售 实习生 ] 在 [ 内部销售 ] 团队，您将与业界顶尖的人员一同共事并产生深远的社会影响 。 内部销售实习生将运用他们的交流技巧与行业知识，通过电话、 Web 和电子邮件向客户销售公司产品与服务，推动与合作伙伴的合作，最终实现产品解决方案的销售 。 关键职责 ： ·        学习团队合作以及跨部门沟通相关技能，了解和学习世界 500 强企业领先的管理方式、业务模式和跨团队协作技能 。 ·        学习 IT 前沿技术。包括但不限于： IT 数字化转型，云计算、大数据、人工智能，现代化数据中心基础架构等先进解决方案，学习主流解决方案 。 ·        提供客户开发至客户维护技能学习；优质的企业培训资源，帮助在时间管理、技能提升、职业规划管理上不断提 升 。 ·        管理客户信息，并通过电话和电子邮件等多种方式与客户建立联系，通过沟通来挖掘客户业务机 会 。 ·        通过团队合作赢取客户订单，并协调订单的交付，学习销售策略，掌握销售流程 。 基本要求 ： ·        良好的沟通能力和学习能 力 ·        对销售岗位高度热 忱 ·        2025  届本科及以上学历优 先 戴尔科技集团旗下拥有多家企业，面向客户提供各种创新技术和服务产品组合，旨在助力组织和个人构建数字化未来并实现工作、生活和娱乐方式转型。客户至上、互利共赢、积极创新、追求成效、诚信经营是我们的准则。加入我们独具魅力的大家庭，体验崇尚多元化和包容性的企业文化，享受颇具竞争力的薪酬、奖励方案、优厚福利以及宝贵的学习和发展机会，轻松拓展职业生涯。 了解 我们如何弥合多元化差距 。 截止日期： 2024 年 6 月  30 日 戴尔秉持所有员工工作机会平等的原则，致力于为员工提供 ⼀个无歧视、无骚扰的工作环境。戴尔的所有雇用决策基于业务需求、工作要求以及资历，与⺠族、肤色、宗教或信仰、国籍、出身或种族、性别（包括怀孕）、年龄、身体、精神或知觉障碍、 HIV 状况、性取向、性别认同和 / 或表达、婚姻、民事结合或同居伴侣关系状况、过去或现在的兵役、家族病史或遗传信息、家庭或 ⽗⺟状况或任何其他受我们运营地点的法律法规保护的状况无关。戴尔决不容忍基于任何上述特征的歧视或骚扰。单 击 此处 ，了解有关戴尔多元化和包容性文化的详细信息 . Job Description: 2024  校园招聘   商用客户内部销售实习 生 即使在数字领域具有开创性的产品也不能做到自我销售。在戴尔，我们下定决心要为每一个客户及合作   伙伴提供高品质的一流体验。这种体验首先从我们开创性的技术产品组合开始，即客户端解决方案、高端电子设备、配件、移动产品、企业解决方案、服务和软件包。内部销售团队为我们的技术产品组合注入了活力。开发持久的关系、建立和谐的环境并依靠自身完美无瑕的交流技巧，通过电话、 Web 和电子邮件向客户销售产品，这是该团队引以为傲的资本 。 欢迎加入我们 [ 厦门 ] 的 [内部销售 实习生 ] 在 [ 内部销售 ] 团队，您将与业界顶尖的人员一同共事并产生深远的社会影响 。 内部销售实习生将运用他们的交流技巧与行业知识，通过电话、 Web 和电子邮件向客户销售公司产品与服务，推动与合作伙伴的合作，最终实现产品解决方案的销售 。 关键职责 ： ·        学习团队合作以及跨部门沟通相关技能，了解和学习世界 500 强企业领先的管理方式、业务模式和跨团队协作技能 。 ·        学习 IT 前沿技术。包括但不限于： IT 数字化转型，云计算、大数据、人工智能，现代化数据中心基础架构等先进解决方案，学习主流解决方案 。 ·        提供客户开发至客户维护技能学习；优质的企业培训资源，帮助在时间管理、技能提升、职业规划管理上不断提 升 ·        管理客户信息，并通过电话和电子邮件等多种方式与客户建立联系，通过沟通来挖掘客户业务机 会 ·        通过团队合作赢取客户订单，并协调订单的交付，学习销售策略，掌握销售流程 。 基本要求 ： ·        良好的沟通能力和学习能 力 ·        对销售岗位高度热 忱 ·        2025  届本科及以上学历优 先 戴尔科技集团旗下拥有多家企业，面向客户提供各种创新技术和服务产品组合，旨在助力组织和个人构建数字化未来并实现工作、生活和娱乐方式转型。客户至上、互利共赢、积极创新、追求成效、诚信经营是我们的准则。加入我们独具魅力的大家庭，体验崇尚多元化和包容性的企业文化，享受颇具竞争力的薪酬、奖励方案、优厚福利以及宝贵的学习和发展机会，轻松拓展职业生涯。 了解 我们如何弥合多元化差距 。 截止日期： 2024 年 6 月  30 日 戴尔秉持所有员工工作机会平等的原则，致力于为员工提供 ⼀个无歧视、无骚扰的工作环境。戴尔的所有雇用决策基于业务需求、工作要求以及资历，与⺠族、肤色、宗教或信仰、国籍、出身或种族、性别（包括怀孕）、年龄、身体、精神或知觉障碍、 HIV 状况、性取向、性别认同和 / 或表达、婚姻、民事结合或同居伴侣关系状况、过去或现在的兵役、家族病史或遗传信息、家庭或 ⽗⺟状况或任何其他受我们运营地点的法律法规保护的状况无关。戴尔决不容忍基于任何上述特征的歧视或骚扰。单 击 此处 ，了解有关戴尔多元化和包容性文化的详细信息 Job ID: R228491 Dell’s Flexible & Hybrid Work Culture At Dell Technologies, we believe our best work is done when flexibility is offered. We know that freedom and flexibility are crucial to all our employees no matter where you are located and our flexible and hybrid work style allows team members to have the freedom to ideate, be innovative, and drive results their way. Finance & Accounting Internship Program 2024 (4 - 6 Months)   We are a global, multi-billion-dollar corporation – and Accounting is vital to reflecting our staggering earnings, profits, cash balances and other financial results. To meet this challenge, we implement best practices, provide general financial support, resolve queries, prepare reports and provide statistics.   We rely on our analysts to develop, interpret and implement financial concepts for planning and control.  Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as an  Undergraduate Intern  on our  Finance & Accounting  Team in  Bayan Lepas, Penang. What you’ll achieve As a Finance & Accounting Intern, you will perform tasks of varying complexity, requiring judgement with limited direct supervision. You will work with various groups within the company on ​special projects and  tasks. You will: Work on Accounting, Corporate Finance or Business Operations related projects Enhance communication, presentation, analytical and practical skills Attend structured trainings and perform on the job  experience Complete respective project according to goal set out by hiring manager. Upon successful completion of internship, present findings and learnings to Finance Leadership Team Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:  Essential Requirements Undergraduate - Bachelor Degree in Accounting / Finance / Management CGPA of 3.4 or higher Strong communication skills Leadership qualities with involvement in University activities Who we are We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you. Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us. Secureworks (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a global cybersecurity leader that secures human progress with Secureworks® Taegis™, a SaaS-based, open XDR platform built on 20+ years of real-world threat intelligence and research, improving customers’ ability to detect advanced threats, streamline and collaborate on investigations, and automate the right actions. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team. Role Responsibilities  Build and develop high performance security operations teams by leading and mentoring people for success. Support the hiring process by constantly improving the recruitment process and conducting the interviews. Develop and review technical training plans and facilitate career development for security analysts of all seniority levels within the team. Define, implement, improve SOC team processes and procedures to support unified delivery. Oversee and perform operational monitoring and analysis of the work performed by the team members (team/analyst workload measurements, quality assurance, etc.). Coordinate critical ManagedXDR service outages and support communication across different teams that are involved in handling major outages that affect the service and/or the platform, including on-call situations. Provide the needed support to setup the ManagedXDR team for changes and coordinate internal projects that are impacting ManagedXDR. Act as an escalation point for ManagedXDR deliverables and contribute to root cause analysis reports. Collaborate with other teams and their members that are involved in supporting Taegis related services like: Sales, CX, Product, Engineering, Customer Success and Client Situation in order to provide a high level of customer satisfaction. Establish and maintain metrics that help provide assistance with managing team operations to a high level of productivity and operational efficiency. Work with Taegis senior leadership to define, collect, and deliver proper metrics for reporting to upper management and tracking team performance. Manage all the administrative processes related to the team such as performance evaluation, timesheet submission, Workday operations, holiday approval based on capacity management, appropriate shift coverage/capacity, internal team meetings sync Requirements Knowledge Knowledge and experience in running teams of more than 5 people. Familiar with root cause analysis methodologies - writing and delivery. Understanding of security incidents investigation methodologies. Understanding of threat hunting methodologies using both endpoint and network-based telemetry. Knowledge of adversarial attack tactics and techniques. Knowledge of applications, cloud technologies, endpoints and network security concepts. Performing both endpoint and network-based investigations. Understands latest cybersecurity threats & techniques used by global threat actors. Skills and Abilities Client-focused with a passion for delivering service excellence. Ability to have consultative conversations with the customer focused on service delivery concepts, processes even technical investigations. Ability to adjust in a fast-paced multidisciplinary environment, prioritize efforts, manage customer expectations, and have professional negotiation skills. Ability to mentor team members. Strong problem solving, analytical skills, and maintaining a sense of ownership. Works independently with minimal supervision; self-starter and highly motivated. Great leadership and coaching skills. Influencing - the ability to convince others of his opinions and determine them to follow. Education/Experience 1+ year experience in a people coordination role & 5+ years of relevant IT experience. Completion of a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent program in Computer Science, Network Security, Information Security or other applicable field and 5+ years of work experience in the field. Preferred Certifications Industry certification from vendors: ISC2, GIAC, EC-Council, Cisco, Juniper, CompTIA, ITIL, Unix, Microsoft, Oracle, etc. (eg: ITIL, CISM, GCIA, GWAPT, GCIH, GCFA/GCFE, GREM, OSCP/OSCE, eLearn THP or similar certification preferred) Language English - Very strong verbal and written skills Why work with us?
